message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. A lodged ureteral stone can cause obstruction and consequent increase in Bowman's space hydrostatic pressure, resulting in decreased filtration rate. None of the other options are expected changes in glomerular filtration.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. When a ureteral stone is lodged and causes obstruction, there will be an increase in Bowman's space hydrostatic pressure due to the dilation of the proximal tubule and the blockage of flow downstream. This can lead to a reduction in glomerular filtration rate. The other options are incorrect as they do not reflect changes that occur during ureteral stone obstruction.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. When a ureteral stone blocks the urinary tract, there is an increase in Bowman’s space hydrostatic pressure due to the build-up of pressure upstream from the blockage. This can lead to decreased glomerular filtration rate (GFR). None of the other options are related to this process.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. When a ureteral stone is lodged, it leads to an increase in Bowman's space hydrostatic pressure, which can lead to a decrease in glomerular filtration rate. This is due to the back pressure of urine in the renal tubules, which can impede the flow of blood into the glomerulus. Therefore, the answer is (B) increase in Bowman's space hydrostatic pressure. The other options are not related to the changes that occur in glomerular filtration during a ureteral stone obstruction.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. A lodged ureteral stone can cause obstruction and increase Bowman's space hydrostatic pressure, leading to a decrease in glomerular filtration rate. Therefore, (B) increase in Bowman's space hydrostatic pressure is the correct answer. Increase in glomerular capillary oncotic pressure would actually decrease glomerular filtration rate. Filtration fraction, which is the ratio of glomerular filtration rate to renal plasma flow, may or may not change depending on the extent of obstruction.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. A lodged ureteral stone can lead to urinary obstruction, which can increase Bowman's space hydrostatic pressure and decrease glomerular filtration rate. Options (A) and (C) are incorrect because the increase in pressure and filtration fraction would not be expected in this scenario. Option (D) is incorrect because a change in filtration fraction would be expected in this situation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. A lodged ureteral stone will cause an increase in Bowman's space hydrostatic pressure, which will reduce glomerular filtration rate (GFR) and increase filtration fraction. There will be no change in glomerular capillary oncotic pressure.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. A lodged ureteral stone can cause obstruction and increase the Bowman's space hydrostatic pressure, leading to a decrease in glomerular filtration rate. There is no change in glomerular capillary oncotic pressure or filtration fraction.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. When a kidney stone is lodged in the ureter, there is an obstruction in the urinary tract which would lead to an increase in Bowman's space hydrostatic pressure. This causes a decrease in the glomerular filtration rate (GFR). There would not be an increase in glomerular capillary oncotic pressure or filtration fraction.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. A lodged ureteral stone would cause an obstruction and an increase in Bowman's space hydrostatic pressure. This can result in a decrease in glomerular filtration rate and an increase in filtration fraction. There would not be an increase in glomerular capillary oncotic pressure, as this is influenced by protein levels and would not be affected by a ureteral stone.
